item.title: Senior Data Scientist
item.description:
You are as unique as your background, experience and point of view. Here, you’ll be encouraged, empowered and challenged to be your best self. You\'ll work with dynamic colleagues - experts in their fields - who are eager to share their knowledge with you. Your leaders will inspire and help you reach your potential and soar to new heights. Every day, you\'ll have new and exciting opportunities to make life brighter for our Clients - who are at the heart of everything we do. Discover how you can make a difference in the lives of individuals, families and communities around the world.

Job Description:

Role Summary

Within Sun Life, the Analytics & Insights teams are comprised of savvy and intellectually curious professionals who are on a mission to transform how we apply data and analytics to support Sun Life becoming client-centric. An integral part of the Analytics & Insights organization, the Data Science team supports Canadian business units in their journey to leverage data and analytics as a foundational pillar in delivering business value

Reporting to the Director, Data Science, as a Senior Data Scientist you will focus on supporting Canadian business units in accelerating the growth and application of analytics in driving value.  The senior data scientist will leverage practical experience in applying varied data science techniques & offering advice/inputs to help with the design, development and implementation of analytics use cases.

Sun Life views success in this role in demonstration of these key attributes:

Fierce curiosity. You are drawn to discovering and leveraging new data and taking on challenging business puzzles. An inquisitive mind. Driven to ask questions to help lead projects to commercial value and not being afraid that the innovation attempts can and will lead to failing. A passion for solving problems.  The most successful data scientists’ solution for what the right data to use, they solve using the most suitable (not most advanced) algorithms for the problem at hand and figure out how to execute and deliver with highest efficiency. Technical skills in both data and computer science. There are 3 core technical skills we look for: in-depth coding knowledge of an analytical tool(s) (i.e., Python); data science techniques and concepts; working with structured data (SQL) Thirst for learning. You are a data scientist who is constantly updating their knowledge of data science state-of-the-art.

What will you do?

  • Apply best in breed data science including descriptive, predictive and machine learning techniques from the design to implementation that impacts the business.

  • Focus on Feature Engineering, Model Training and Model Evaluation in addition to data munging / wrangling

  • Identify the right algorithms and statistical techniques for a specific project as well as the best features for a model.  Advise junior members on the same.

  • Make business recommendations with effective presentations of findings at multiple levels of stakeholders

  • An active contributing member to the analytics community to help foster and grow the data science community at Sun Life

  • Champion and support diversity and inclusion

What will you need to succeed?

  • BSc/M.S. in a statistical, mathematical, or technical field (i.e., computer science) or equivalent experience

  • 3+ years experience in developing and implementing data science techniques (predictive, prescriptive, ML etc.)

  • Comfortable writing complex SQL queries to extract and integrate data from multiple database sources

  • Proficient in using one or more statistical programming languages (i.e., Python) for data science

  • Experience with AWS services including SageMaker

  • Experience with machine learning including supervised and unsupervised models

  • Demonstrated experience in data transformation & data manipulation

  • Experience working with Structured vs. Unstructured data

  • Experience with Big Data Technologies: Hadoop, HDFS, Hive, HBase,, Spark is strongly desirable

  • Effective and concise oral and written storytelling and insights communication skills

  • Ability to work on multiple projects in parallel while managing constantly changing deadlines and priorities

  • Ability to document work and effectively prioritize documentation

What will be nice to have?

  • Past experience in life insurance/wealth management, or other financial services industry (e.g., retail banking, credit card, property and casualty insurance)

Unique Requirements

The candidate selected for this role is required to have special clearance from the Royal Canadian Mounted Police. To see if you are eligible for this clearance, please review the section 201 on the Federal Government site (http://iss-ssi.pwgsc-tpsgc.gc.ca/msi-ism/ch2-prt1-eng.html) ​

What\'s in it for you?

  • Competitive salary and bonus structure influenced by market range data

  • 20 days vacation per year and an innovative sabbatical program

  • A friendly, collaborative and inclusive culture

  • Being part of our Analytics community, where we share best practices and broaden skill-sets

  • Flexible Benefits from the day you join to meet the needs of you and your family

  • Pension, stock and savings programs to help build and enhance your future financial security

  • Fitness and wellness programs that help you balance work and life and enjoy a healthier lifestyle

The Base Pay range is for the primary location for which the job is posted.  It may vary depending on the work location of the successful candidate or other factors.  In addition to Base Pay, eligible Sun Life employees participate in various incentive plans, payment under which is discretionary and subject to individual and company performance.  Certain sales focused roles have sales incentive plans based on individual or group sales results. 

Diversity and inclusion have always been at the core of our values at Sun Life. A diverse workforce with wide perspectives and creative ideas benefits our clients, the communities where we operate and all of us as colleagues. We welcome applications from qualified individuals from all backgrounds.

Persons with disabilities who need accommodation in the application process or those needing job postings in an alternative format may e-mail a request to thebrightside@sunlife.com.

At Sun Life we strive to create a flexible work environment where our employees are empowered to do their best work. Several flexible work options are available and can be discussed throughout the selection process depending on the role requirements and individual needs.

We thank all applicants for showing an interest in this position. Only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Salary Range:

74,900/74 900 - 125,900/125 900

Job Category:

Advanced Analytics

Posting End Date:

09/01/2022

item.title: Lead Data Scientist/ Director, Data Science
item.description:
You are as unique as your background, experience and point of view. Here, you’ll be encouraged, empowered and challenged to be your best self. You\'ll work with dynamic colleagues - experts in their fields - who are eager to share their knowledge with you. Your leaders will inspire and help you reach your potential and soar to new heights. Every day, you\'ll have new and exciting opportunities to make life brighter for our Clients - who are at the heart of everything we do. Discover how you can make a difference in the lives of individuals, families and communities around the world.

Job Description:

Role Summary

As one of Sun Life Canada’s largest business units, Insurance Solutions is responsible for designing and distributing leading-edge life and health insurance products to over 2 million individual retail Clients across Canada.

Reporting to the AVP, Innovation and Analytics, the Lead Data Scientist / Director will lead machine learning and predictive analytics initiatives within Insurance Solutions to conceptualize, develop, and operationalize data science solutions for specific use cases across multiple functional areas including underwriting, sales, product management and actuarial.  The successful candidate will also provide intellectual leadership on the application of advanced analytics techniques to business problems and coach a high-performing team of analytics professionals.

The ideal candidate is a challenge-seeking, intellectually curious, results-oriented analytics leader with a passion for leveraging data to drive business outcomes and a thirst for continuous learning.

What will you do?

  • Lead a team to identify, develop, and operationalize high quality, robust machine learning solutions to meet the use cases of key functional areas within Insurance Solutions (e.g. underwriting, sales, product management, actuarial)

  • Lead the research, development, and enhancement of existing models (e.g. Sun Life’s accelerated underwriting model)

  • Lead the research and evaluation of new data sources, both internal and external; apply machine learning and deep learning techniques to extract actionable insights from available data; write complex SQL queries to extract and integrate data from multiple database sources

  • Liaise with senior executives, product managers, actuaries and sales teams, to define use cases and deliver innovative solutions in order to help meet their business growth and profitability objectives

  • Coach and grow a high-performing team of analytics professionals with clear direction and proactive leadership, strategic assignment of responsibilities, and other training opportunities

What do you need to succeed?

  • Genuine interest in life insurance and learning the business

  • M.S. or PhD in mathematics, computer science or other relevant fields, or equivalent work experience

  • 7+ years of industry experience and expert knowledge in machine learning and data science, with hands-on experience building and deploying statistical / machine learning models

  • 3+ years experience leading data science projects

  • 3+ years experience in managing and leading a small team of data scientists

  • Extensive knowledge of machine learning and deep learning tools and concepts (e.g. Random Forests, Neural Networks, XGBoost), including applications in NLP

  • Experience using one or more statistical programming languages (e.g., Python, R) to work with data sets

What will be nice to have?

  • Life and health insurance industry experience, preferably a background in underwriting, distribution, actuarial, or product management

  • Experience with cloud-based big data tools and platforms: AWS, SageMaker

  • In depth understanding of big data technologies: Hadoop, HDFS, Hive, HBase, Storm, Spark, Kafka

  • Experience with data analytics and data visualization best practices

What’s in it for you?

  • Competitive salary and bonus structure influenced by market range data

  • 20 days vacation per year and an innovative sabbatical program

  • A friendly, collaborative and inclusive culture

  • Being part of our Analytics community, where we share best practices and broaden skill sets

  • Flexible Benefits from the day you join to meet the needs of you and your family

  • Pension, stock and savings programs to help build and enhance your future financial security

  • Fitness and wellness programs that help you balance work and life and enjoy a healthier lifestyle

The Base Pay range is for the primary location for which the job is posted.  It may vary depending on the work location of the successful candidate or other factors.  In addition to Base Pay, eligible Sun Life employees participate in various incentive plans, payment under which is discretionary and subject to individual and company performance.  Certain sales focused roles have sales incentive plans based on individual or group sales results. 

Diversity and inclusion have always been at the core of our values at Sun Life. A diverse workforce with wide perspectives and creative ideas benefits our clients, the communities where we operate and all of us as colleagues. We welcome applications from qualified individuals from all backgrounds.

Persons with disabilities who need accommodation in the application process or those needing job postings in an alternative format may e-mail a request to thebrightside@sunlife.com.

At Sun Life we strive to create a flexible work environment where our employees are empowered to do their best work. Several flexible work options are available and can be discussed throughout the selection process depending on the role requirements and individual needs.

We thank all applicants for showing an interest in this position. Only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Salary Range:

104,000/104 000 - 171,700/171 700

Job Category:

Advanced Analytics

Posting End Date:

item.title: Data Scientist - Client Insights & Analytics
item.description:
You are as unique as your background, experience and point of view. Here, you’ll be encouraged, empowered and challenged to be your best self. You\'ll work with dynamic colleagues - experts in their fields - who are eager to share their knowledge with you. Your leaders will inspire and help you reach your potential and soar to new heights. Every day, you\'ll have new and exciting opportunities to make life brighter for our Clients - who are at the heart of everything we do. Discover how you can make a difference in the lives of individuals, families and communities around the world.

Job Description:

Role Summary

Within Sun Life Canada, the Data Analytics & Insights team is a multi-disciplinary center of excellence comprised of savvy and intellectually curious professionals who are on a mission to transform how we apply data and analytics to support Sun Life clients live healthier lives and achieve financial security

Reporting to the Manager, Data Science as a Data Scientist you will focus on supporting Canadian business units and Client Experience Office (CXO) in accelerating the growth and application of analytics in driving value.  The data scientist will leverage practical experience in applying varied data science techniques & offering advice/inputs to help with the design, development and implementation of analytics use cases.

Sun Life views success in this role in demonstration of these key attributes:

Fierce curiosity. You are drawn to discovering and leveraging new data and taking on challenging business puzzles. An inquisitive mind. Driven to ask questions to help lead projects to commercial value and not being afraid that the innovation attempts can and will lead to failing. A passion for solving problems.  The most successful data scientists’ solution for what the right data to use, they solve using the most suitable (not most advanced) algorithms for the problem at hand and figure out how to execute and deliver with highest efficiency. Technical skills in both data and computer science. There are 3 core technical skills we look for: in-depth coding knowledge of an analytical tool(s) (i.e., SAS, Python); data science techniques and concepts; working with structured data (SQL) Thirst for learning. You are a data scientist who is constantly updating their knowledge of data science state-of-the-art.

What will you do?

  • Apply best in breed data science including descriptive, predictive, machine learning and AI techniques from the design to implementation that impacts the business.

  • Focus on Feature Engineering, Model Training and Model Evaluation in addition to data munging / wrangling

  • Identify the right algorithms and statistical techniques for a specific project as well as the best features for a model

  • Make business recommendations with effective presentations of findings at multiple levels of stakeholders

  • An active contributing member to the analytics community to help foster and grow the data science community at Sun Life

  • Champion and support diversity and inclusion

What will you need to succeed?

  • 2+ years experience in developing and implementing data science techniques (predictive, prescriptive, ML etc.)

  • Comfortable writing complex SQL queries to extract and integrate data from multiple database sources

  • Proficient in using one or more statistical programming languages (i.e., SAS, Python) for data science

  • Effective and concise oral and written storytelling and insights communication skills

  • Ability to work on multiple projects in parallel while managing constantly changing deadlines and priorities

  • Ability to document work and effectively prioritize documentation

  • BSc/M.S. in a statistical, mathematical, or technical field (i.e., computer science) or equivalent experience

What will be nice to have?

  • Past experience in life insurance/wealth management, or other financial services industry (e.g., retail banking, credit card, property and casualty insurance)

Unique Requirements

The candidate selected for this role is required to have special clearance from the Royal Canadian Mounted Police. To see if you are eligible for this clearance, please review the section 201 on the Federal Government site (https://www.tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca/esc-src/personnel/pdcf-rsrp-eng.html)

What\'s in it for you?

  • Competitive salary and bonus structure influenced by market range dat

  • 15 days vacation per year and an innovative sabbatical program

  • Remote/ Hybrid work environment

  • A friendly, collaborative and inclusive culture

  • Being part of our Analytics community, where we share best practices and broaden skill-sets

  • Flexible Benefits from the day you join to meet the needs of you and your family

  • Pension, stock and savings programs to help build and enhance your future financial security

  • Fitness and wellness programs that help you balance work and life and enjoy a healthier lifestyle

The Base Pay range is for the primary location for which the job is posted.  It may vary depending on the work location of the successful candidate or other factors.  In addition to Base Pay, eligible Sun Life employees participate in various incentive plans, payment under which is discretionary and subject to individual and company performance.  Certain sales focused roles have sales incentive plans based on individual or group sales results. 

Diversity and inclusion have always been at the core of our values at Sun Life. A diverse workforce with wide perspectives and creative ideas benefits our clients, the communities where we operate and all of us as colleagues. We welcome applications from qualified individuals from all backgrounds.

Persons with disabilities who need accommodation in the application process or those needing job postings in an alternative format may e-mail a request to thebrightside@sunlife.com.

At Sun Life we strive to create a flexible work environment where our employees are empowered to do their best work. Several flexible work options are available and can be discussed throughout the selection process depending on the role requirements and individual needs.

We thank all applicants for showing an interest in this position. Only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

56,300/56 300 - 92,900/92 900

Advanced Analytics

09/01/2022

item.title: Business Data Engineer
item.description:
You are as unique as your background, experience and point of view. Here, you’ll be encouraged, empowered and challenged to be your best self. You\'ll work with dynamic colleagues - experts in their fields - who are eager to share their knowledge with you. Your leaders will inspire and help you reach your potential and soar to new heights. Every day, you\'ll have new and exciting opportunities to make life brighter for our Clients - who are at the heart of everything we do. Discover how you can make a difference in the lives of individuals, families and communities around the world.

Job Description:

At Sun Life, we work together, share common values and encourage growth and achievement. We offer many career paths that attract a wide variety of talent and skills. Follow a path that lets your talents shine.

Role Summary:

The Client Experience Office (CXO) is an important pillar of Sun Life’s corporate strategy and as such, is seeking experienced data engineering individuals with a proven track record working with data consumers to extract meaningful insights from enterprise data.  Business data engineers play an indispensable role in assembling the necessary data products that fuel myriad of analytical models used by our various business units across Canada.

Reporting to the Director of CXO Data Science, the Business Data Engineer will be a key member of Canadian Analytics CoE responsible for building enriched data products that provide deep insights about our Client, Advisor, Product, Transactions along with their intricate relationships.  The Business Data Engineer will work with data analysts and data scientists to help answer complex business enquires such as identifying new business opportunities, understanding our client behaviour and optimizing areas of our sales cycles.

What will you do?

  • Obsessed with understanding our enterprise data and interpreting it in the best way possible to derive business value

  • Design and engineer data models that represent our key business entities such as our Advisor, Client & Product

  • Ensure high level of data quality and data integrity are maintained across data sources for business

  • Convert complex business and technical rules into logic for data flows and data pipelines

  • Work with our Data Science teams to implement Machine Learning pipelines

  • Collaborate with stakeholders and incorporate into solution design for various use case requirements

  • Standardize metadata into a common glossary along with the necessary documentation for data consumers

What do you need to succeed?

  • 3-5 years experience with engineering data products as input to various analytical models

  • 3-5 years building feedback loops between model deployment and its data – i.e. tune & tweak data products to achieve scale, optimization, etc.

  • Sound understanding of data management principles (data warehousing, data quality, master data management, etc.)

  • Demonstrate expertise in dimensional data modelling and passion for analytics

  • Proven track record in leveraging SQL and SQL-based programming to solve business problems

  • Intermediate- to expert-level programmatic expertise working with distributed (Hadoop, AWS) platforms

  • Ability to translate complex business requirements into a set of data ingestion pseudocode, schema-on-read topologies and/or dimensional models that are necessary inputs to data engineering exercises

  • Proven ability to leverage knowledge of data engineering to extract, conform and integrate a variety of operational data sources into production-grade data products

  • Familiarity with programming in Python, Scala, Java or equivalent

  • Demonstrate blend of tenacity, creativity, and discipline required to develop ground breaking self-serve data models that data scientists can consume

  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills; have executive presence and proven ability to partner with Data Scientists to articulate insights gleaned from the model and the underlying data

Education and Qualifications:

  • Undergraduate degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Engineering, or equivalent

  • Graduate degree in business or quantitative science strongly preferred

  • 3-5 years hands-on experience working on Cloud Platforms (on AWS, Azure, etc.) with data processing and analytical tools such as Hive SQL, Apache Spark, AWS Glue, etc.

  • 5 years hands-on experience with relational database systems, data warehouses, dimensional models etc.

                                                                                                                   

What would be nice to have?

  • Experience working in a large financial services organization

  • Knowledge of fundamental statistical models & techniques

  • Proven experience working in an agile pod (Scrum, Kanban, etc.)

What is in it for you?

  • Competitive salary and bonus structure influenced by market range data

  • Entitlement to flexible benefits and vacation

  • A friendly, collaborative and inclusive culture

The Base Pay range is for the primary location for which the job is posted.  It may vary depending on the work location of the successful candidate or other factors.  In addition to Base Pay, eligible Sun Life employees participate in various incentive plans, payment under which is discretionary and subject to individual and company performance.  Certain sales focused roles have sales incentive plans based on individual or group sales results. 

Diversity and inclusion have always been at the core of our values at Sun Life. A diverse workforce with wide perspectives and creative ideas benefits our clients, the communities where we operate and all of us as colleagues. We welcome applications from qualified individuals from all backgrounds.

Persons with disabilities who need accommodation in the application process or those needing job postings in an alternative format may e-mail a request to thebrightside@sunlife.com.

At Sun Life we strive to create a flexible work environment where our employees are empowered to do their best work. Several flexible work options are available and can be discussed throughout the selection process depending on the role requirements and individual needs.

We thank all applicants for showing an interest in this position. Only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Salary Range:

68,400/68 400 - 111,700/111 700

Job Category:

Advanced Analytics

Posting End Date:

26/12/2021

item.title: Senior Data Scientist (Remote)
item.description:
You are as unique as your background, experience and point of view. Here, you’ll be encouraged, empowered and challenged to be your best self. You\'ll work with dynamic colleagues - experts in their fields - who are eager to share their knowledge with you. Your leaders will inspire and help you reach your potential and soar to new heights. Every day, you\'ll have new and exciting opportunities to make life brighter for our Clients - who are at the heart of everything we do.  ​

item.title: Software Developer, Data Platform Engineering
item.description:
You are as unique as your background, experience and point of view. Here, you’ll be encouraged, empowered and challenged to be your best self. You\'ll work with dynamic colleagues - experts in their fields - who are eager to share their knowledge with you. Your leaders will inspire and help you reach your potential and soar to new heights. Every day, you\'ll have new and exciting opportunities to make life brighter for our Clients - who are at the heart of everything we do. Discover how you can make a difference in the lives of individuals, families and communities around the world.

Job Description:

Role Summary:

At Data & Analytics Engineering our team is focused on enabling analytics at Sun Life through delivering robust, scalable, secure and reusable platforms and services that operate within our Enterprise Cloud, API and DevOps environments.

We are looking for a software developer to join our fast paced and high performing Data Engineering team to provide data and analytics capabilities to our business. You will use your engineering prowess and experience building out data platforms to help us deliver core data and application pipelines, frameworks and infrastructure that enable our business to provide insights and respond to the needs of our clients in real-time.

Sun Life values diversity and does not discriminate based on background or personal experience. We encourage everyone with a passion for developing great software to apply.

What will you do?

  • Work within an Agile pod to build core data and analytics platforms, applications and self-service capabilities
  • Build robust data pipelines that integrate data from various sources to enable analytics in our Cloud environment.
  • Build and deploy APIs and highly available services that adhere to internal governance controls and deployment platforms
  • Work closely with our data science and analytics partners to deliver useful integration and delivery pipelines to facilitate various analytics use-cases like recommendation systems
  • Operate in a Shift-Left testing environment and prioritize writing efficient, tested and clear code
  • Participate in improving the supportability and transparency of the applications and services we build by creating clear and comprehensive documentation, monitoring/alert systems and centralized logging

What you need to succeed?

  • Bachelors Degree in Computer Science or Technology
  • 2+ years of experience working with the following: 
    • Scala, Java 8+ and Python3 programming languages
    • Docker and container-orchestration tools like Kubernetes
    • Jenkins, Artifactory, and Ansible
    • traditional Big Data suite (e.g. HDFS, MapReduce/Spark/etc.)
    • streaming technologies, such as Kafka
    • SQL databases, such as Postgres
    • a Cloud Service Provider (e.g. Amazon Web Services, Microsoft Azure, Google Cloud, etc.)
  • Familiarity with the Microservice Architectures
  • Familiarity with various NoSQL database designs (e.g. Key-Value, Document, Wide-Column, Graph, etc.).
  • Knowledge of basic Machine Learning concepts (e.g. classification versus regression, bias-variance tradeoff, etc.)

Preferred Skills

  • Excellent communication skills (both written and oral), combined with strong interpersonal skills
  • Experience with either Kanban or Scrum working methodologies

Note:

  • This role requires reliability check, this means that you have resided in Canada for the last 5 years.

What’s in it for you:

  • Competitive salary and bonus structure influenced by market range data

  • Pension, stock and savings programs to help build and enhance your future financial security

  • An environment of continuous learning and improvement

  • Flexible hours and periodic work from home options

LI- SJ

The Base Pay range is for the primary location for which the job is posted.  It may vary depending on the work location of the successful candidate or other factors.  In addition to Base Pay, eligible Sun Life employees participate in various incentive plans, payment under which is discretionary and subject to individual and company performance.  Certain sales focused roles have sales incentive plans based on individual or group sales results. 

Diversity and inclusion have always been at the core of our values at Sun Life. A diverse workforce with wide perspectives and creative ideas benefits our clients, the communities where we operate and all of us as colleagues. We welcome applications from qualified individuals from all backgrounds.

Persons with disabilities who need accommodation in the application process or those needing job postings in an alternative format may e-mail a request to thebrightside@sunlife.com.

At Sun Life we strive to create a flexible work environment where our employees are empowered to do their best work. Several flexible work options are available and can be discussed throughout the selection process depending on the role requirements and individual needs.

We thank all applicants for showing an interest in this position. Only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Salary Range:

56,300/56 300 - 92,900/92 900

Job Category:

IT - Technology Services

Posting End Date:

item.title: Support Engineer, Analytics
item.description:
You are as unique as your background, experience and point of view. Here, you’ll be encouraged, empowered and challenged to be your best self. You\'ll work with dynamic colleagues - experts in their fields - who are eager to share their knowledge with you. Your leaders will inspire and help you reach your potential and soar to new heights. Every day, you\'ll have new and exciting opportunities to make life brighter for our Clients - who are at the heart of everything we do. Discover how you can make a difference in the lives of individuals, families and communities around the world.

Job Description:

Role Summary

As Support Engineer, Analytics, and a member of the Data and Analytics, Data and Engineering Operations team, you will utilize your knowledge in the data science stream to partner with internal and external clients to ensure the technology and process solutions delivered/supported meet their needs.  This team thrives on challenges; we learn from each other and provide a rich environment where people can grow their skills.  We strive to hire only the best, so you will be working with bright people in a dynamic and highly collaborative work environment.

What will you do?

  • Design, develop, test, deploy and support workloads on AWS SageMaker models.  In this role you can learn AWS Sagemaker if you have experience with other comparable cloud environment tools.

  • Develop automation code and provide fixes and improvements using Python/R

  • Review existing data science models to code and identify areas for improvement, present findings to data scientists, and help to execute the recommendations

  • Prepare data from various internal sources for ingestion into the AWS SageMaker environments

  • Develop and support customized interactive Tableau dashboards for internal business partners.  In this role you can learn Tableau by leveraging your current experience with other similar tools.

  • Deliver training materials and documentation that lay out the processes for using various analytics toolsets

  • Work directly with a wide array of audiences to structure analytical problems and approaches, and provide ongoing support, communication, and prompt resolution for data science related products

  • Participate in provisioning and management of cloud-based enterprise Data and Analytics tools

  • Develop and drive innovative Data and Analytics thinking, including Predictive Modelling, and Data Science application development

  • Maintain current knowledge on Quantitative Analysis, Machine Learning and Analytics tools and techniques

  • Drive process improvement through analysis and best practices

What do you need to succeed?

  • Post-Secondary degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, or another related field

  • Must have 1+ years experience in using Python/R and SQL (Hadoop, Microsoft SQL Server, SAS, Oracle, etc) to analyze data and gather valuable insights

  • Demonstrated quantitative, analytical, problem-solving, conceptual thinking skills, and data transformation and manipulation experience

  • Conceptual understanding of the following topics:

  • Machine Learning (ML) techniques, and comprehension of existing algorithms and ML lifecycle components

  • Statistics, linear algebra, probability theory

  • Computer science fundamentals

  • Database theory, ETL/data pipeline design and data modelling

  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills

  • Ability to work independently and eager to take on responsibility

  • Strong organizational and time management skills

  • Working knowledge of MS Office Suite of products (Word, Excel, PowerPoint)

What will be nice to have?

  • Experience and/or training in Cloud platforms like AWS, MS Azure, and Google Cloud Platform

  • Knowledge of machine learning practices and experience applying them to real datasets

  • Understanding of agile teams and patterns

  • Solid understanding of software development lifecycle, agile teams, rapid test, etc

  • Experience with relational databases and data modeling techniques

What’s in it for you?

  • Competitive salary influenced by market range data

  • 15 days vacation per year and innovative sabbatical package

  • Remote work/ Hybrid Work environment

  • A friendly, collaborative and inclusive culture

  • Flexible Benefits from the day you join to meet the needs of you and your family

  • Fitness and wellness programs that help you balance work and life and enjoy a healthier lifestyle

Unique Requirements

The candidate selected for this role is required to have special clearance from the Royal Canadian Mounted Police. To see if you are eligible for this clearance, please review the section 201 on the Federal Government site (http://iss-ssi.pwgsc-tpsgc.gc.ca/msi-ism/ch2-prt1-eng.html)

The Base Pay range is for the primary location for which the job is posted.  It may vary depending on the work location of the successful candidate or other factors.  In addition to Base Pay, eligible Sun Life employees participate in various incentive plans, payment under which is discretionary and subject to individual and company performance.  Certain sales focused roles have sales incentive plans based on individual or group sales results. 

Diversity and inclusion have always been at the core of our values at Sun Life. A diverse workforce with wide perspectives and creative ideas benefits our clients, the communities where we operate and all of us as colleagues. We welcome applications from qualified individuals from all backgrounds.

Persons with disabilities who need accommodation in the application process or those needing job postings in an alternative format may e-mail a request to thebrightside@sunlife.com.

At Sun Life we strive to create a flexible work environment where our employees are empowered to do their best work. Several flexible work options are available and can be discussed throughout the selection process depending on the role requirements and individual needs.

We thank all applicants for showing an interest in this position. Only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Salary Range:

56,300/56 300 - 92,900/92 900

Job Category:

IT - Technology Services

Posting End Date:

09/01/2022

item.title: Intermediate Cloud Infrastructure Analyst
item.description:
You are as unique as your background, experience and point of view. Here, you’ll be encouraged, empowered and challenged to be your best self. You\'ll work with dynamic colleagues - experts in their fields - who are eager to share their knowledge with you. Your leaders will inspire and help you reach your potential and soar to new heights. Every day, you\'ll have new and exciting opportunities to make life brighter for our Clients - who are at the heart of everything we do. Discover how you can make a difference in the lives of individuals, families and communities around the world.

Job Description:

Description du poste :

Le poste d’analyste intermédiaire, infrastructure infonuagique, est un pilier essentiel de l’équipe Opérations et infrastructure infonuagique. Ce groupe très estimé au sein du secteur Données et analytique joue un rôle crucial en matière de mégadonnées, d’apprentissage machine et d’analytique par la conception, le développement et l’entretien des infrastructures d’analytique et des technologies d’intergiciels sur les plateformes infonuagiques.

Les fonctions

  • Travailler avec les composantes logiciel en tant que service (SaaS) et plateforme en tant que service (PaaS) d’Amazon Web Services (AWS), l’administration d’Hadoop et d’autres technologies connexes.
  • Évaluer les fonctions et les caractéristiques des services infonuagiques et des technologies connexes.
  • Participer à des projets d’infrastructure de petite et de moyenne envergure tout au long de leur cycle de vie ainsi que définir et gérer les résultats attendus, en plus d’en faire le suivi au moyen de technologies définies.
  • Collaborer étroitement avec les autres membres de l’équipe, les responsables techniques, les chefs d’équipe, la direction, les secteurs des TI spécialisés et les équipes de soutien des applications pour assurer l’uniformité de la prestation et de la qualité des services infonuagiques.
  • Tenir à jour les documents et les procédures pour l’ensemble des plateformes infonuagiques et définir les exigences en collaboration avec d’autres développeurs et spécialistes.
  • Élaborer des scripts et des fonctions pour soutenir les processus internes et améliorer la performance des systèmes.
  • Définir, consigner et mettre en œuvre des normes et des procédures cohérentes.
  • Partager à tour de rôle la responsabilité des fonctions de garde en tout temps, du soutien des changements après les heures normales de travail et des mises à l’essai des plans antisinistres.

Les aptitudes pour réussir

  • Excellent dossier universitaire et diplôme universitaire en informatique, en mathématiques, en sciences ou dans un domaine connexe.  
  • Connaissance et expérience du secteur des technologies de l’information avec un excellent dossier universitaire dans un domaine connexe.
  • Capacité de comprendre, de décrire et de mettre en pratique des concepts complexes.
  • Excellentes aptitudes pour la communication verbale et écrite.
  • Passion pour les données et l’analytique en tant que carrière.
  • Excellent sens de l’organisation et capacité de mener plusieurs tâches de front.
  • Capacité à faire preuve d’initiative et à apprendre de façon indépendante.

Exigences particulières

  • La personne choisie doit obtenir une habilitation de sécurité (et doit avoir le statut de résident canadien depuis au moins 5 ans).

Les atouts

  • Maîtrise de Linux.
  • Connaissance ou expérience de l’environnement Amazon Web Services (AWS).
  • Connaissance du développement Web, des outils d’alimentation ETL (extraire, transformer et charger) et de l’établissement de rapports.
  • Expérience avec les langages de script (Linux Bash, Microsoft Powershell, etc.).
  • Connaissance des concepts des bases de données comme le mappage des données et la modélisation logique et physique des données.
  • Expérience pour donner des présentations à divers publics comprenant des intervenants, des Clients, etc.

Les avantages pour vous

  • Prendre part à notre parcours qui vise à développer la meilleure expérience numérique qui soit.
  • Des garanties à la carte dès votre premier jour de travail pour répondre à vos besoins et à ceux de votre famille.
  • Des programmes de mieux-être qui soutiennent les trois piliers de votre santé : santé mentale, physique et financière.
  • Un système de soutien solide pour la formation continue comprenant des cours offerts par l’entreprise, des accès à des plateformes d’apprentissage en ligne, des occasions de rotation, etc.
  • Un horaire de travail flexible qui doit inclure une plage horaire habituelle de travail.

Role Summary:

As an Intermediate Cloud Infrastructure Analyst, you will be an essential part of the Cloud Infrastructure & Operations team; a highly recognized group within the Data & Analytics division that plays a direct role in Big Data, Machine Learning and Analytics technologies by designing, building and supporting Analytics infrastructure, and middleware technologies on Cloud platforms.

What will you do?

  • Understand and work with Amazon Web Services (AWS) Platform as a Service (Paas), Software as a Service (SaaS), and Hadoop administration and related technologies.
  • Evaluate functions and features of cloud services and related technologies.
  • Involvement with small and medium size infrastructure projects, and participate in projects throughout the entire project lifecycle, and define, manage and track project deliverables using defined technologies.
  • Work closely with other team members, technical/team leads, management, specialized IT areas and application support teams to ensure consistent delivery and quality of platform and cloud services.
  • Maintain up-to-date documentation and procedures for all supported cloud-related platforms, and define requirements in cooperation with Developers and other Specialists.
  • Develop scripts and functions to support internal processes and improve system performance.
  • Define, document and implement consistent standards and procedures
  • Share the responsibility of 7X24 rotational on-call duties, after hour change support and disaster recovery support

What you need to succeed?

  • High academic credentials and University level degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Science or a related field.  
  • Knowledge and experience in Information Technology with high academic credentials in a related field.
  • Understand, can describe and can put into action complex concepts.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
  • Passion for data and analytics as a career.
  • Strong organizational skills with the ability to handle several tasks efficiently.
  • Demonstrated ability to take initiative and learn independently.

Unique Requirements

  • Ability to receive Security clearance is required for this role [minimum of 5 consecutive years of residency in Canada].

a

What will be nice to have?

  • Proficiency with Linux.
  • Familiarity and/or experience with Amazon Web Services (AWS) environment.
  • Knowledge of Web development, Extract, Transform and Load (ETL) and Report development.
  • Scripting languages (Linux Bash, Microsoft Powershell, etc.).
  • Knowledge of database concepts such as data mapping, logical and physical data modeling.
  • Experience giving presentations to a wide variety of audiences including stakeholders, clients, etc.

What’s in it for you?

  • Being part of our journey in developing the next greatest digital experience.
  • Flexible Benefits from the day you join to meet the needs of you and your family.
  • Wellness programs that support the three pillars of your health – mental, physical and financial.
  • An extensive support system for continual learning including company-run courses, access to online learning platforms, opportunity for rotations, etc.
  • A flexible work schedule, so long it includes core working hours.

The Base Pay range is for the primary location for which the job is posted.  It may vary depending on the work location of the successful candidate or other factors.  In addition to Base Pay, eligible Sun Life employees participate in various incentive plans, payment under which is discretionary and subject to individual and company performance.  Certain sales focused roles have sales incentive plans based on individual or group sales results. 

Diversity and inclusion have always been at the core of our values at Sun Life. A diverse workforce with wide perspectives and creative ideas benefits our clients, the communities where we operate and all of us as colleagues. We welcome applications from qualified individuals from all backgrounds.

Persons with disabilities who need accommodation in the application process or those needing job postings in an alternative format may e-mail a request to thebrightside@sunlife.com.

At Sun Life we strive to create a flexible work environment where our employees are empowered to do their best work. Several flexible work options are available and can be discussed throughout the selection process depending on the role requirements and individual needs.

We thank all applicants for showing an interest in this position. Only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Salary Range:

56,300/56 300 - 92,900/92 900

Job Category:

IT - Technology Services

Posting End Date:
